educational_objective: Diagnose Paget disease of the breast.
question_text: A 50-year-old woman is evaluated for an eczematous patch on her right nipple that has been present for several months, as shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: Paget disease of the breast (Option C) is the most likely diagnosis. Paget disease of the breast consists of an erythematous, irregularly bordered plaque on the nipple-areolar complex, representing an extension of a ductal adenocarcinoma of the breast or ductal carcinoma in situ. Mammograms may be normal. Diagnosis is established by skin biopsy.

figures.title: Paget Disease of the Breast
figures.short_title: stem Paget Disease of the Breast
